column4: Hi all! Having a bit of a crisis here and would be grateful for some help.  How can I log on as su ?
There's the problem ... I only have one password and it says it's wrong
Yes but I was only ever asked to supply a password once during installation and I have that written down
that password should work with sudo
to test, try 'sudo ls' and enter your user password
then sudo is working
you cannot login as root, by default
we recommend using sudo instead
you can read that url for more info
but 'sudo ls' worked earlier?
that's a file list (or so i assme)
what error message do you get when using sudo ?
fair enough
here's maybe a better test: try 'ls -l /home' and then 'sudo ls -l /home'   -- if it works, you should see exactly the same output
yay
and with sudo it did the same thing?
it won't be in colour this time -- that doesn't matter
ok. that means that sudo works. Whenever you are asked for a password, enter your user password
i was making absolutely certain that sudo works -- i.e., that you can become 'super-user'

what device?
